summary: This bill, known as the PARTNER Act (Providing Appropriate Recognition and Treatment Needed to Enhance Relations Act), amends the International Organizations Immunities Act to extend diplomatic privileges and immunities to several international and regional organizations. These include the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN), the Pacific Islands Forum, the Caribbean Community, and the African Union. The bill grants the President the authority to extend these privileges, subject to certain conditions, and also modifies existing provisions regarding the African Union Mission.
